sources.title: Fatty Joins The Force
sources.description: A Fatty Arbuckle comedy from 1913 co-starring Al St John and Edgar Kennedy

sources.title: FATTY JOINS THE FORCE (1913) -- Roscoe Arbuckle
sources.description: FATTY JOINS THE FORCE (1913) Starring: Roscoe Arbuckle, Dot Farley, Charles Avery, Edgar Kennedy, Minta Durfee, Hank Mann, George Nichols Directed by Mack Sennett, George Nichols Keystone Film Company William Thomas Sherman, wts@gunjones.com, http://www.mn-hp.com

sources.title: Fatty Joins the Force
sources.description: Title: Fatty Joins the Force Summary: After rescuing the Police Commissioner's daughter from drowning, Fatty is rewarded with a position on the force, but soon finds that the job isn't all it's cracked up to be. Directed by: George Nichols Actors: Production Company: Keystone Film Company Release Date: 24 November 1913 (USA) Aspect Ratio: REMOVE_TAG When 'Fatty' rescues a young girl from drowning, she turns out to be the police commissioner's daughter. The grateful commissioner offers Fatty a position on the force, and at first Fatty is very pleased with his new position. But he soon runs into difficulties, as his attempt to break up a fistfight only brings him embarrassment. Then, when he confronts a group of mischievous young boys, his real problems begin.

metadata.Plot: When 'Fatty' rescues a young girl from drowning, she turns out to be the police commissioner's daughter. The grateful commissioner offers Fatty a position on the force, and at first Fatty is very pleased with his new position. But he soon runs into difficulties, as his attempt to break up a fistfight only brings him embarrassment. Then, when he confronts a group of mischievous young boys, his real problems begin.
metadata.Actors: Roscoe 'Fatty' Arbuckle, Charles Avery, Lou Breslow
